item.title: Adopting LVM
item.description: I use Arch Linux on every machine in my possession. Within a year of its use, I realized what Arch Linux F**kups really mean and why people cry about it. But I figured out a escape to a problem I always faced during a f**kup, It’s the disk partitions and re-installation. The Trouble Traditionally you would have a setup like this. n00b: - /dev/sda1 - / (OS installation) - /home/user (home folder) Your everyhing is in the root partition.
